Article Title: Elon Musk agrees with JK Rowling's post stating 'Sex is real and matters'
Article Text:
What JK Rowling said on gender ideology

Here‚Äôs the full text of her post

This 'why do you care about a tiny fraction of the population?' line is, and always was, utterly ridiculous.

Gender ideology has undermined

freedom of speech

, scientific truth, gay rights, and women's and girls' safety, privacy and dignity. It's also caused irreparable physical damage to vulnerable kids.

Nobody voted for it, the vast majority of people disagree with it, yet it has been imposed, top down, by politicians, healthcare bodies, academia, sections of the media, celebrities and even the police. Its activists have threatened and enacted violence on those who've dared oppose it. People have been defamed and discriminated against for questioning it. Jobs have been lost and lives have been ruined, all for the crime of knowing that sex is real and matters.

When the smoke clears, it will be only too evident that this was never about a so-called vulnerable minority, notwithstanding the fact that some very vulnerable people have been harmed. The power dynamics underpinning our society have been reinforced, not dismantled. The loudest voices throughout this entire fiasco have been people insulated from consequences by their wealth and/or status. They aren't likely to find themselves locked in a prison cell with a 6'4" rapist who's decided his name's now Dolores. They don't need state-funded rape crisis centres, nor do they ever frequent high street changing rooms. They simper from talk show sofas about those nasty far-right bigots who don't want penises swinging around the girls' showers, secure in the knowledge that their private pool remains the safe place it always was.

Those who've benefited most from gender identity ideology are men, both trans-identified and not. Some have been rewarded for having a cross-dressing kink by access to all spaces previously reserved for women. Others have parlayed their delicious new victim status into an excuse to threaten, assault and harass women. Non-trans-identified leftybros have found a magnificent platform from which to display their own impeccably progressive credentials, by jeering and sneering at the needs of women and girls, all while patting themselves on the back for giving away rights that aren't theirs.

The actual victims in this mess have been women and children, especially the most vulnerable, gay people who've resisted the movement and paid a horrible price, and regular people working in environments where one misplaced pronoun could see you vilified or constructively dismissed. Do not tell me this is about a tiny minority. This movement has impacted society in disastrous ways, and if you had any sense, you'd be quietly deleting every trace of activist mantras, ad hominem attacks, false equivalence and circular arguments from your X feeds, because the day is fast approaching when you'll want to pretend you always saw through the craziness and never believed it for a second.

What ByteDance researchers said about OmniHuman-1



TikTok parent ByteDance has developed a new AI model called OmniHuman-1 . The latest model can generate realistic videos from photos and sound bites. This comes after ChatGPT-maker OpenAI expanded access to its video-generation tool, Sora, making it available to ChatGPT Plus and Pro users in December 2024. Last year, Google DeepMind also announced its Veo model which can create ‚Äúhigh-quality, high-definition videos based on text or image prompts in a wide range of cinematic and visual styles with exceptional speed.‚Äù However, both OpenAI and Google's models that turn photos into videos are still not available to the public.In a paper (seen by the South China Morning Post), the ByteDance team behind OmniHuman-1 claimed that the multimodal model excels at creating videos of people speaking, singing, and moving with a quality ‚Äúsignificantly outperforming existing audio-conditioned human video-generation methods‚Äù. While OmniHuman-1 has not yet been publicly released, sample videos have generated significant buzz online. One of the demo videos shows a 23-second clip of Albert Einstein giving a speech that was shared on YouTube.In a recently published technical paper, ByteDance researchers Lin Gaojie, Jiang Jianwen, Yang Jiaqi, Zheng Zerong, and Liang Chao introduced a new training strategy that integrates diverse datasets of text, audio and movement to enhance video-generation models. With this approach, the company aims to tackle challenges faced by global researchers in scaling such models.ByteDance also claimed that its method advances conventional video generation without directly naming competing AI tools. The researchers highlighted that their data-mixing approach allows for realistic video generation across various aspect ratios and body proportions, ranging from close-up facial shots to full-body visuals.The generated clips exhibit detailed facial expressions synchronised with audio, along with natural head and gesture movements, potentially enabling broader real-world applications.Among the sample videos released, one features a man delivering a TED Talk-style speech with lifelike hand gestures and synchronised lip movements, making it nearly indistinguishable from a real recording, the report adds.

Article Title: AI researchers develop 'reasoning' model for under $50 like OpenAI's o1 and DeepSeek's R1
Article Text:
How researchers developed reasoning model

A team of AI researchers from Stanford University and the University of Washington have achieved a breakthrough in AI development by training a sophisticated ‚Äúreasoning‚Äù model for less than $50 in cloud compute credits. Researchers used AI models by Google, Alibaba to create a chatbot with reasoning level as good as the ChatGPT-maker OpenAI ‚Äôs o1 LLMs.The model, named s1, is claimed to exhibit performance comparable to cutting-edge reasoning models like OpenAI's o1 and DeepSeek's R1 on tests evaluating math and coding abilities. The s1 model , along with the data and code used in its training, has been made available on GitHub.The researchers behind s1 said that they utilised a readily available base model and refined it through a process known as distillation ‚Äì a technique that involves extracting the ‚Äúreasoning‚Äù capabilities from another AI model by training s1 on its answers.The researchers claim that their model s1 has been distilled from Google's Gemini 2.0 Flash Thinking Experimental model. This approach mirrors the method used by Berkeley researchers who created an AI reasoning model for around $450 last month.The researchers behind s1 aimed to identify the simplest approach to achieve strong reasoning performance and "test-time scaling," which allows an AI model to deliberate more before generating a response.‚ÄúTest-time scaling is a promising new approach to language modeling that uses extra test-time compute to improve performance,‚Äù the researchers said in their paper published last week (via TechCrunch), adding that they ‚Äúseek the simplest approach to achieve test-time scaling and strong reasoning performance.‚ÄùThe s1 research suggests that reasoning models can be effectively distilled using a relatively small dataset and a process called supervised fine-tuning (SFT), where an AI model is explicitly trained to mimic specific behaviors in the dataset.‚ÄúFirst, we curate a small dataset s1K of 1,000 questions paired with reasoning traces relying on three criteria we validate through ablations: difficulty, diversity, and quality. Second, we develop budget forcing to control test-time compute by forcefully terminating the model‚Äôs thinking process or lengthening it by appending ‚ÄúWait‚Äù multiple times to the model‚Äôs generation when it tries to end. This can lead the model to doublecheck its answer, often fixing incorrect reasoning steps,‚Äù the researchers said.
Article Summary: Researchers from Stanford University and the University of Washington have created a sophisticated reasoning model for less than $50 in cloud compute credits. The model, named s1, is claimed to exhibit performance comparable to cutting-edge reasoning models like OpenAI's o1 and DeepSeek's R1.

Article Title: Zomato gets 'Eternal' as new name; CEO Deepinder Goyal says: It scares me to my core because ...
Article Text:
Take a look at the post here



What Zomato CEO said about changing the company name



‚ÄúDear fellow shareholders,

A few weeks ago, on December 23rd, we entered the BSE Sensex. Coincidentally, that was exactly the day I started writing the first line of code for Zomato ‚Äî then Foodiebay ‚Äî seventeen years ago, in 2007. Becoming the first tech startup in India to make it to the Sensex is a moment of pride and also a moment of reflection, bringing with it a heightened sense of responsibility ‚Äî responsibility towards the people we serve, the people who build with us, and the country we live in.

In many ways, we feel like we‚Äôve broken some ice. In a world where success often seems reserved for the privileged, we have shown that people from ordinary backgrounds, armed with nothing but conviction and hard work, can come together, defy the odds, create large-scale impact, and, in under two decades, build one of the top thirty listed companies in India. This journey has created tremendous wealth ‚Äî not just for me, but for our employees, institutional investors, and retail shareholders. But I did not start Zomato to make money. I started it because I wanted to do something worthwhile with my life. One weekend, I went around town, collected takeaway menus, and uploaded them onto a website ‚Äî purely in the spirit of service. I never thought it could be a business. I wasn‚Äôt looking for revenue. I was simply trying to be helpful.

Zomato is an accidental company. It was born out of a simple desire to serve, and over time, it became a business. And the journey has been nothing short of extraordinary. Our work has created millions of direct and indirect jobs. It endears my heart when our delivery partners, restaurant partners, and store partners tell me how we empower them, to make more money, to have more freedom, and to better provide for their families. A lot of them tell me that they are now able to send their kids to better schools, and are able to keep them in those schools, which was sometimes not possible earlier. They tell me that their life is more full of hope than what it used to be.

I am a student of system design thinking, and one of the goals for me at Zomato has been to design an organisation that lasts beyond its current set of leaders ‚Äì an organisation where culture drives outcomes, more than strategy; something that is an institution in itself, and not just a company.

We shape our institutions, and then they shape us. But institutions are not just legal entities, groups of people, or physical structures; they are also the mental models and paradigms within which we operate. One such paradigm, often overlooked in shaping a company‚Äôs future, is its name.

When we acquired Blinkit, we started using ‚ÄúEternal‚Äù (instead of Zomato) internally to distinguish between the company and the brand/app. We also thought that we would publicly rename the company to Eternal, the day something beyond Zomato became a significant driver of our future. Today, with Blinkit, I feel we are there. We would like to rename Zomato Ltd., the company (not the brand/app), to Eternal Ltd.

Eternal is a powerful name, and to be honest, it scares me to my core. It is a tall order to live up to. Because ‚ÄòEternal‚Äô carries both a promise and a paradox. True permanence isn‚Äôt built on bold claims of invincibility or the swagger of success. It is forged in the quiet understanding that our immortality stems from our mortality ‚Äî because the day we think we will last forever simply because we declare it, we begin our end.

To work at Eternal will be to wake up every day knowing that our forever is earned in moments of self-doubt, in acknowledging our limitations, in our constant hunger to be better than we were yesterday.

This isn‚Äôt just a name change; it is a mission statement. A reminder etched into our identity that we will endure ‚Äî not because we are here, but because we need to get there.

Our Board has approved this change today and I request our shareholders to also support this change. If and when it is approved, our corporate website will transition from zomato.com to eternal.com. We will also change our stock ticker from ZOMATO to ETERNAL. Eternal will comprise four major businesses (as of now) ‚Äì Zomato, Blinkit, District, and Hyperpure.

A company has multiple founding moments, and I hope this change is another one in our journey into the future.

Deepinder‚Äù
Article Summary: Zomato is changing its name from Zomato.com to Eternal Ltd. The company will also change its stock ticker from ZOMATO to ETERNAL. CEO says the change is part of a mission to create an organisation that lasts beyond its current leaders.

Article Title: Donald Trump's order: 8,000 webpages 'Deleted' from the Internet; says '... would have ruined our America, and now it's dead'
Article Text:
Agencies impacted by the purge



Memo to government employees



In a sweeping move last week, the US President Donald Trump 's administration removed over 8,000 federal web pages from the Internet, targeting content related to diversity, gender, and equality initiatives (popularly called DEI). This action follows executive orders mandating the elimination of programs promoting "gender ideology."President Trump defended these measures, stating, "DEI would have ruined our country, and now it's dead." He also signed an executive order aimed at restricting gender care for individuals under the age of 19, calling for an end to federal support for such care.The purge has reportedly affected numerous agencies, including the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), the Census Bureau, and the Food and Drug Administration. Notably, the CDC's main data portal was taken offline to comply with an executive order aimed at combating "gender ideology extremism."Web pages containing information on climate initiatives and transgender care have been among those removed. For instance, the CDC's Social Vulnerability Index and Environmental Justice Index‚Äîtools assessing health risks in vulnerable communities‚Äîhave been taken down.A notice on the CDC's website states, "CDC's website is being modified to comply with President Trump's Executive Orders." Similarly, the Census Bureau's page on sexual orientation and gender identity was temporarily inaccessible.These actions align with a memo from the Office of Personnel Management, which directed all federal agencies to end diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) programs. The memo outlined steps to terminate federal funding of gender ideology and ordered the removal of related content from public platforms.Additionally, federal employees have been instructed to remove pronouns from their email signatures, and agencies are required to recognize individuals strictly by their biological sex. The State Department has also suspended passport applications using a gender-neutral marker such as 'X.'The removal of these web pages has raised concerns among researchers and public health experts, who emphasize the importance of access to accurate data for effective healthcare and research. Many are now working to archive lost information to preserve it for future use.Legal challenges to these executive actions have already begun, with lawsuits filed against the administration's rollback of transgender rights and DEI programs.
Article Summary: US President Donald Trump's administration removed over 8,000 federal web pages from the Internet. This follows executive orders mandating the elimination of programs promoting "gender ideology" President Trump defended these measures, stating, "DEI would have ruined our country and now it's dead"

Article Title: Qualcomm CEO gives an update on its legal fight with Arm

Democratic Representative Mark Pocan is set to introduce new legislation aimed at preventing special government employees, including high-profile figures like Elon Musk , from securing federal contracts. The bill, named the Eliminate Looting of Our Nation by Mitigating Unethical State Kleptocracy (ELON MUSK) Act, is designed to ensure that individuals with government influence cannot steer federal spending toward their personal business interests.Pocan‚Äôs move comes in response to concerns about Musk‚Äôs growing influence over federal contracts through his companies, including SpaceX and Starlink, which have received billions in government funding. According to Pocan, allowing individuals with substantial financial interests to participate in government decision-making could lead to conflicts of interest, misuse of taxpayer funds, and an unfair advantage for certain private entities.The proposed legislation has already sparked significant debate, with supporters arguing that it promotes transparency and accountability, while critics view it as a politically motivated attack on Musk. As the bill moves forward, it could have major implications for how federal contracts are awarded and who is eligible to receive them.The ELON MUSK Act seeks to prohibit special government employees from holding federal contracts. According to a press release shared by Pocan on X (formerly Twitter, now owned by Musk), the legislation aligns with existing restrictions placed on Members of Congress and other federal employees, preventing them from benefiting financially from their government roles.The bill specifically targets individuals who have the authority to influence or recommend federal spending decisions, arguing that such positions create a risk of self-dealing and favoritism in contract allocation. Pocan contends that figures like Musk, who hold federal contracts while also maintaining influence over government agencies, pose an ethical dilemma that must be addressed.If passed, the legislation would require all U.S. government agencies to terminate contracts held by such employees, ensuring that taxpayer money is not funneled toward their personal or corporate interests.Pocan has been vocal about his concerns regarding the potential abuse of power by special government employees. In a statement, he emphasized that no government employee‚Äîspecial or otherwise‚Äîshould have financial interests in businesses that receive government contracts.He specifically cited Elon Musk as a prime example of how such a system can be exploited. Musk‚Äôs companies, SpaceX and Starlink, hold lucrative contracts with the U.S. government, providing services such as satellite internet and space exploration. Pocan argues that Musk‚Äôs involvement in federal decision-making could give him undue influence over contract allocations, potentially directing more government money toward his own enterprises.Pocan did not hold back in his criticism of Musk, accusing him of using his government position to secure billions of dollars in contracts for his businesses. According to Pocan, Musk has received over $20 billion in government funding and now holds an advisory role in the federal government, giving him even more control over financial decisions.Pocan declared.Pocan‚Äôs remarks reference Musk‚Äôs current role as the Director of the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) under Donald Trump‚Äôs administration. Critics argue that Musk‚Äôs involvement in government policy could further blur the lines between public service and private gain, making it crucial to establish legal safeguards against potential conflicts of interest.Musk has been a major recipient of government contracts through his companies. SpaceX has long been a key partner of NASA and the U.S. Department of Defense, providing rocket launch services, satellite deployment, and other aerospace technologies. Meanwhile, Starlink, Musk‚Äôs satellite internet company, has secured contracts with the U.S. military and government agencies to provide communication services in remote areas and during emergencies.Musk‚Äôs defenders argue that his companies deliver cutting-edge technology and innovation that benefit the U.S. government and the public. They claim that Pocan‚Äôs bill unfairly targets Musk for political reasons rather than addressing broader issues of government transparency and contract fairness.

LinkedIn is testing an AI-powered job search tool that aims to transform how people find their next career opportunity. According to a report, the tool utilizes a custom large language model (LLM) to analyse the data, helping job-seekers discover potential roles they might otherwise miss in traditional searches.LinkedIn CEO Ryan Roslansky told Wired the need for such a tool and how it will help those finding jobs on the platform.‚ÄúThe reality is, you don‚Äôt find your dream job by checking a set of keywords,‚Äù said Roslansky, adding that the new tool, ‚Äúcan help you find relevant jobs you never even knew to search for.‚ÄùThe Microsoft-owned company developed its own LLM, similar to the technology powering ChatGPT, to analyse its vast dataset and interpret complex search queries.As per the company, unlike traditional searches that rely on matching keywords in job titles, this new tool performs a deeper analysis of job descriptions, company information, industry trends, and user posts across the platform.The tool ‚Äì which is currently being tested by a select group of users ‚Äì allows job seekers to input queries such as ‚Äúfind me a role where I can use marketing skills to help the environment" or ‚Äúshow jobs in marketing that pay over $100K.‚ÄùIt can even identify skills that job seekers might need to develop to pursue specific roles, the report said.‚ÄúWe are really using LLMs throughout the entire stack of our search and recommender system, all the way from query understanding to retrieval to ranking,‚Äù Rohan Rajiv, a director of product at LinkedIn, told the publication.To address the challenges and potential bias posed by LLMs, LinkedIn has implemented safety measures, including ‚Äúaddressing criteria that could inadvertently exclude certain candidates, or bias in the algorithms that could impact how qualifications are assessed,‚Äù according to LinkedIn spokesperson Suzi Owen.The innovation comes as AI technology is gaining ground in providing means for how people interact with the internet. Article Title: Amazon to unveil next-generation Alexa AI this month
Article Text:
Representative Image

Amazon is gearing up to launch its new Alexa generative AI voice service , marking the most significant upgrade to the product since its initial introduction over a decade ago. The company has scheduled a press event for February 26 in New York to preview the new service.The revamped AI service will be able to respond to multiple prompts in sequence and even act as an "agent" on behalf of users by taking actions for them without their direct involvement.This contrasts with the current iteration, which generally handles only a single request at a time.Initially, Amazon plans to roll out the new Alexa service to a limited number of users and will not charge for it, though it has considered a $5 to $10 monthly fee. The company will also continue to offer "Classic Alexa," the version broadly available today for free.The revamp carries inherent challenges, including the possibility of fabricated answers, known as hallucinations, which are common in generative AI chatbots from companies like OpenAI and Alphabet. Despite these challenges, Amazon is hopeful that the new Alexa can convert some of its hundreds of millions of users into paying customers, generating a return for the unprofitable business.The new version of Amazon Alexa is set to release just before Apple begins testing a new iteration of Siri equipped with enhanced Apple Intelligence capabilities. Apple has announced that Siri will be updated with on-screen awareness, personal context, and expanded functionality within apps. These updates are expected to enhance Siri's capabilities for iPhone, iPad, and Mac users.
Article Summary: Amazon is gearing up to launch its new Alexa generative AI voice service. The company has scheduled a press event for February 26 in New York to preview the new service. Initially, Amazon plans to roll out the new Alexa service to a limited number of users.
